page.title: 19THE SHRAWLEY POSTMAN
page.content: Mr.Wilcox or 'Wally' as he is known to everyone has lived in the village for over seventy years. For the last sixteen years he has been the village postman. His day begins at 4.45a.m. and after a cup of tea he leaves home at 5.30a.m. He goes to Holt Heath to sort the mail before starting on his rounds. He delivers down Shrawley Road as far as Wolstan's Farm and The Monastery, 20-25 miles each day.He is given breakfast at The Monastery each day probably in return for his help in delivering their milk and papers.He is amazed at some of the things now sent by post such as an 8-10ft ladder,a bicycle or a greenhouse, which he is supposed to deliver on a bicycle. His longest days are at Christmas time when he finishes work at 3 p.m.He has earned the respect of the local dogs by carrying biscuits in his pocket.
